text:
Top50. Miejsce 10-te.  
 Data ważności:  27.11.2017 
 Batch:  941 
 Kolor:  Błotny brązowy, piwo jest mętne i słabo przejrzyste. 
 Piana:  Na początku wysoka, zbita o drobnej strukturze i kremowym kolorze. Redukuje się do chmurki i świetnie krążkuje na szkle. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest bardzo ciekawy. Z pewnością[ wybitnie słodowy. Czuć przypieczoną skórkę od chleba, toffi, sporo melanoidowych detali.
Jest lekka czekolada i sporo nut korzennych i przyprawowych. Całość okrasza delikatna ogniskowa, dymna wędzonka.
Fajnie ;) 
 Smak: Kosmos! Kompletny kosmos dla kubków smakowych. To piwo to jak mieszanka wielu stylów. Ogromna porcja słodów: karmel, przypieczony pszenny chleb, tosty, toffi. Dalej nuty gorzkiej czekolady i minimalna paloność przypominająca delikatną białą kawę.
W oddali masa ciemnych owoców, w szczególności wędzonych śliwek. Wędzonka dymna, śliwkowa, przechodzi w woń palonego drewna z ogniska. Daleko na szarym końcu piramidy nuty torfowe.
Goryczka średniej siły, dość wyraźna z dymionym tłem.
Ciało pełne, tekstura gęsta.
Alkohol dobrze wkomponowany.
Dość zapychające, ale smaczne.  

 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  <br/)

Traditional Ale to bardzo ciekawy typ piw łączący ze sobą cechy historycznych i zapomnianych stylów piwnych.
Bestefar to piwo bogate, wielowymiarowe o mocnym słodowym charakterze. Łączy ze sobą cechy słodów z dość wyraźną dymioną, a nawet i torfową wędzonką. 
Fajne, nietypowa piwko.
W sam raz jako odskocznia od popularnych piwnych stylów.

Flaske 0,5l smakt desember 2012. Aroma malt, karamell, røyk, noe lakris. Utseende mørk brun nesten sort med lys beige skum. Smak malt, røyk, karamell, lakris og kaffe. En smaksrik juleøl med fin fylde og litt julesteming.

Aromat: piękny, intensywny aromat suszonych śliwek i czekolady, delikatna i bardzo aromatyczna wędzonka pochodząca od wędzonych słodkich owoców.
Wygląd: ciemnomiedziane, nieprzejrzyste, z ładną centymetrową warstwą piany, po chwili redukującej się do obwódki na powierzchni
Smak: słodkie, gęste, jest tu dużo gorzkiej czekolady, suszone owoce, wędzona śliwka, łagodna i bardzo harmonijna wędzonka, świetnie pasująca do całości. Dalej mamy pralinki, kakao, likierowość i paloną i kawową goryczkę w kontrze. Wysycenie niskie, bardzo przyjemny finisz gorzkiej czekolady rozpuszczającej się w ustach i trochę kawowej cierpkości. Moje już było dobrze ułożone, alkohol niewyczuwalny ani w smaku ani w zapachu. Bardzo dobre i ciekawe piwo
Lots of smoke in both the body and aroma, was afraid it might disappoint as the last beer of the evening but it most certainly did not. Some sweet caramels. Just really delicious.

Draft Half Pint at Cask Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico, London in Nov 2011 - Very Dark Brown (almost Black) in colour. Flat; Zero carbonation. Very Fruity; berries, juniper?, raisins etc. Spicy; ginger. Malty; roasty malts, toffee, some dark chocolate. Smooth. Sweet fruity spicy malty throughout. Surprisingly easy drinking for ABV. Very drinkable. (2011-11-05)

Flaske. Uklar brunaktig med noe skum som varer kort. Aromaen er bacon, malt, røsted, rosin og røykt. Smaken er bacon, røykt, røsted og noe salt. Kompleks og spesiell øl. Et kvalitetsøl. Fin passende fylde.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2016 Bouteille avec un BB du 27/11/2017, batch 941 sûrement embouteillée en novembre 2015 selon les différentes évaluations donc bue après 13 mois. Robe brune très foncée pratiquement noire et surmontée dun col de mousse brun et onctueux qui sefface rapidement. Arômes de tourbe fumée, mûres confites, pruneau, chocolat au lait, malt grillé. Notes de grains de café et damande. En bouche, bel harmonie entre le malt fumé et les saveurs de café et chocolat. Par la suite, un peu de pruneau séché, mélasse brûlée, umami (bouillon de boeuf, jambon fumé...). Belle texture lisse et onctueuse, corps moyen. Rien à voir avec les bières de Noël épicées et sucrées et franchement intéressante.

December 23, 2016. Bottle, batch 655, brewed September 19, 2013.
Dark brown almost black with a large creamy tan head. Aroma is malty, fruity and light smokey with dark bread, toffee, canned peaches, some roasted notes, licorice and light earthy spiciness. Taste is light to medium sweet, slight warming, smooth bitterness. Medium to full bodied, soft to average carbonation. Finish is sweet malty with toffee, dark bread, licorice, light smokey and spicy notes, some roasted bitterness. 
Smooth malty and nice smokey note.

500 ml bottle, Batch 918, brewed on Sept. 15, 2015 and bottled on Oct. 13, 2015. Served in a nonic pint glass, the beer pours a very dark brown color with about an inch tan head. Head retention and lacing are both good. Aroma is nice and smoky, the brew smells like smoked malt, molasses, chocolate, and dark fruit. For the most part I think the taste is like the aroma, but theres also some woodiness and Tootsie Roll flavors noticeable. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its a bit slick and smooth with a low/moderate amount of carbonation. I think its a good overall brew, I liked the smokiness in it. The smoke is there, but it doesnt overpower the rest of the brew. Definitely worth picking up! $8.99 a bottle.

Most of the American brewing winter market tends to hearken to the English Strong Ale tradition with brown-colored (and often spiced) catch-all Winter Warmers. HaandBryggeriet Bestefar will make you wish more brewers looked to Scandinavia instead. Bestefar is a brown beer with tons of smoky, savory umami character. It tastes like cured, smoked meat with lots of rich malt to go along with it. It would work beautifully as a companion to the Christmas ham, or it could be enjoyed all by itself as an evening closer. Hard to go wrong with this.

Bottle.

A- Savory, teriyaki, soy sauce, wood, smoke, jerky.

A- Dark red mahogany color, clear liquid, beige head.

T- Jerky, teriyaki sauce, wood, umami, smoke.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, savory finish.

O- Like a mix between a sahti, scotch ale, and smoked ale. Lots of goodness going on. Smoke, umami, fermented sauce, delish! If I come across more Ill be stocking up. Balanced and tasty!
On tap at Refuge. Smoky spicy molasses aroma. Sweet and bitter with big vanilla and smoke notes. Rich and chocolatey with a smooth finish. Great.
33cl bottle. Taste is brown bread, dried plum, raisin, warm spices, hint of smoke, bit of chocolate and char/roast, and molasses. Finishes malty, dirty, some alcohol. Nice one.

Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 25/11/2016 
Color marron, sabor caramelo, malta, ahumada, rica
Denne stout har et sort udseende med et svagt brunt skum. Øllen har en sød karamel aroma og smager deraf med smag af kaffe og noter af lakrids. Bitter afrunding. Medium karbonering.
Aroma of coffee and chocolate with spicy notes. Black with a little light brown head. Medium-high sweetness and light-medium bitterness. Creamy texture, full body. Very tasteful Christmas ale.
UPDATED: OCT 16, 2016 From Zombier. In Teku glass. Watching Los Soprano 4x10-11. Pretty smoky, not so much to make it disgusting but enough to not make it easy to drink. ABV well hidden. Low on foam
Dark brown ale. Herbal armoa, (my wife mentioned shampoo), some chocolate. Starts off with some dark malt and chocolate, some spices and a slight bitter finish.

500 ml bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Malty aroma, caramel, some chocolate notes, dark dried fruits, some smoked notes, spicy too. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

En aroma domina el ahumado intenso pero agradable 
Buen aspecto negro con espuma abundante y persistente color beige
En boca al principio maltoso que dura muy poco para entrar el ahumado potente pero agradable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark pour, thick foamy caramel colored head. Aromas of raisin and licorice. First taste is potent, with the alcohol level very subdued. Amazing beer.
Flaska från SB. Svart med ljusbrunt skum. Doft av choklad och hasselnötsglass. Kaffe med mjölk och choklad i smaken.

Batch 655 från 2013: Svart med brunt skum. Maltig doft med rostade toner, choklad, lakrits, läder, lite mörk torkar frukt och aningen rök. Även i smaken finns en lätt rökighet och stora rostade toner med choklad, kaffe och lakrits och lite pralinsötma.

En mycket trevlig julöl, fyllig, smakrik och välbalanserad med den lilla rökigheten. Den har helt klart rundat till sig under lagringen, mums.

Look; beige bigtop, ultra dark mahogany-cherry body. 
Aroma; roasted malts, tar, dust, attic, liquorice.
Taste; roasted malts, liquorice, orange flavoured dark chocolate, tar, moon anise 
- finishes salty malty. 
Palate, good feel, smooth. 
Overall traditional ale, grandfathers eve sipper?

Bottle. Nice brown colour and moderate head. Rich, rich and rich - and some bitterness. A real winterwarmer!

Bottle. Dark. Soft roasty, dark fruity, ripe fruity, slight molassy, plummy, some chocolate, madeira-y, dark bready nose. Full bodied, good bitters, sweetness, spicy. Prety nice, stable, xnas ale. Spicy, dark fruity.-- bb

Poured into a perfect pint. Batch 490.

3.5 A: Black color. Three fingers of foamy tan head. Retention is pretty good, but just a short ring of lacing is left.

3.75 S: Wow, this is surprisingly dry. Its a roasty, nutty dryness. Sprucey, pine sappiness. Chocolate and caramel. Quite pleasant.

3.25 T: Taste isnt quite as good as the nose. Chocolate, an almost tangy caramel, and a light spiciness. Nuts, pine, and molasses. Not nearly as dry as the nose. Indeed it verges on sweet. Its okay, but Im not a huge fan of the tanginess.

3.0 M: Lighter medium body. Good moderate carbonation. Light creaminess. The big complaint here is that its quite sticky and causes some amylase balling.

3.25 D: Its okay, but its no Odins Tipple.

★ 739 characters


DavoleBomb, Sep 03, 2013
Pours brown to black with a beige head, aroma of chocolate, caramel, roasted, flavor is slightly smoked, caramel, cocoa, burnt bread, medium bodied.

Flaska. Brun öl med ett medelstort beigt skum. Dofter av lakrits, hasselnöt, rosta malt och choklad. Smakinslag av trä, röda bär, rostad malt, örter och choklad. Aningen syrlig i avslutningen. Medelkropp.

Mycket trevlig, mustig doft med inslag av läder, plommon, pomeransskal och lite rök.
Brusande flaska. Brygden är svart och helt ogenomskinlig. Skummet är förvånansvärt läskartat och kort, kanske beroende på åldern (brygd 19 september 2013, batch 655).
Ganska söt brygd med en härligt kryddig attack. Därefter en rund karaktär av choklad, lakrits och lite alkohol. Eftersmaken har en lätt rökig touch och en behaglig, mjuk beska.
Fyllig kropp och en väl tilltagen men inte omotiverad kolsyra.

Bottle. Heavy cereal, nutty and chocolate for the malt, light herbs for the hops, moderate dough for the yeast with toffee, alcohol, fig and tobacco in the background. Head is average to large, frothy to fizzy, tan with some slippery lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is dark brown. Flavor starts lightly to moderately sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly sweet, acidic and bitter. Palate is medium to full, oily with a carbonation between lively and fizzy with silky and stick finish. A well balanced and beautifully crafted Traditional Ale.

2014 version, 500ml bottle, GUSHER! Black with two finger tan head. Aroma of chocolate, slightly sour smoke, leather and some tobacco. Bitter taste with initial smoke, chocolate, some very bitter coffee and alcohol. Kinda hard to put words on... Quite smooth, medium-lively prickly carbonation, warming alcohol.

Piana średniej wielkości, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, szybko opada do kożuszka, ładnie oblepia szkło. Barwa brązowa, nieprzejrzysta z czerwonymi refleksami. W aromacie ciekawe drewniane nuty, wędzony bukiem słód, likier czekoladowy, suszona żurawina. W smaku analogicznie, z tym że wędzonka jest przyjemna, lekko ogniskowo-kiełbaskowa, piwo dość agresywne, na początku słodkie, pełne, ziemiste, po chwili palone i likierowe, następnie dochodzą estry owocowe, wędzona śliwka i ziołowo-alkoholowa goryczka na finiszu. W afterteasie kakao, świeża kawa mielona, prażone ziarno i długi posmak alkoholu, whisky. 
Gdyby nie ten alkohol... może za kilka miesięcy było by idealne...
Pretty much the same as Nissefar, smoky, tobacco hints, pretty heavy on umami but also some molasses character. Nice beer.

From a Norwegian trade with a redditor. Pours a a deep chestnut brown with a light mocha head which lingers around. Aroma is raisins and fresh hazelnuts. Taste is sweet milk chocolate, hazelnuts, red berries. This has a slight warmth to it which is pleasant. Full bodied and very rich.
(bottle - 500 ml) Dark brown pour with a creamy tan head. Caramel and malty aroma with some light fruits. Flavor is very sweet with lots of caramel and toffee malts. Smooth and sweet.

Bottle, batch 582, brewed 08.03.13, expiry 08.03.15. Pitch black colour, brown rocky head that does not stay long. Aroma of coffee, old wood, truffle, a bit of ash. Quite much alcohol, but its ok. Light bitterness. Full body. Good, but lacks something to make it spectacular.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Dark brown colour with a huge off-white head. Guzzles when the bottle is opened.
Aroma: Malt, alcohol, liquorice, spices.
Body: Medium to full body, lively carbonation.
Flavour: Roasted malt, chocolate, spices, liquorice.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Stass place. Thanks Stas. Very dark brown with dark cream head. Roast, mildly smoky, a little vanilla in the nose, deep bitterness, smoky, no-nonsense taste. Full body, a little roasted coffee bean aftertaste.

Bottle. Black with medium, beige head. Medicore lacing. Poor lasting. Aroma of roasted malts (mainly milk chocolate) and tart dark fruits notes (cherries in chocolate), some sour wood. Taste is semi-sweet with quite noticable dark fruits flavours (rasins, currants). Light to medium bitterness esp. in the end. Medium to full body, semi-sweet, soft cabronation, oily texture, finish is quite bitter, no alcohol warmth. In general nice beer, despite high ABV no alc. noticable, highly drinkable with some nice sour accents.

1 pint 9 oz bottle, poured into a snifter at approximately 45 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a deep mahogany brown, which doesnt let much light through in an ordinarily-lit room. Forms a decent-sized pale tan head with good retention, though little to no lacing.

Smell: Thats interesting. Theres more than a hint of some Belgian-esque yeast, with dark fruit and banana in the nose, atop a sweet malty backbone. Theres a just a faint hint of something musty beneath. This smells not unlike a quad, or BSDA.

Taste: Sour springs forth instantly as it touches the tongue, a dry, acetic sour that reminds one of a balsamic vinegar. The sourness floats atop a richly sweet malt, which itself contains dark fruits - hints of plum and black cherry. Through the middle, tones of fireplace ashes and leaves appear and disappear. The finish leaves a touch of the balsamic vinegar, mingled with an almost soda-like sweetness and a trace of burnt wood.

Mouthfeel: Very carbonated, almost sharp to drink, which the vinegar sourness plays off of.

Overall: An interesting beer, definitely of a sort I have never encountered before - much like a Flanders Red or Oud Bruin meeting a quadrupel. I dont know that I would repeat it, but it made for a fascinating experience.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Stas. Pours deep brown with a big bubbly head. Aroma of prunes, coffee, chocolate and smoke. Sweet with dried fruits, chocolate and cocoa flavors. Medium-bodied, well carbonated. Nice.
1/28/2014. From bottle. Dark brown with a tan head. Roasted malt, chocolate, licorice and spices. Bitter flavors, hints of smoke and coffee. A bit of sediment at the bottom of the glass.

Extreme gusher, 1/3 of the beer ended up in various parts of my kitchen.
Aroma is roasty, dry, almost vinous, ABV evident, salty, licorice, ashy, coffee.
Black colour, mocha head, lacing.
Chocolatey sweet, salty, soft bite, warming and complex.
Fullbodied, soft carbonation, salty, warming and roasty finish.
Impressive.
Bottle. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate and spicy caramel aroma. Roasted malty spicy caramel flavor. Has a roasted malty spicy caramel and chocolate finish.

Smells of cloves, pine needles. The taste is complex, full-bodied, slightly smoky, spicy, root beer, juniper berries, coffee, dark syrup. Feel like Santa Claus himself has concocted and mixed a recipe of different beer styles, a Christmas tree and Christmas candy. Minimal bitterness and very little sweetness that still gives a pleasant concealed taste of sweetness. Heats up the dark winter night and give me proper Christmas spirit!
How: Bottle Appearance: dark brown, small head Aroma: coffee, chocolate, wood, spice, Palate: medium to full body , average carbonation

500ml brown bottle, label picturing an old-timey santa, poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is brownish black with a large khaki colored thick foamy head, that when settled left a little lacing on the glass. Aroma of molasses, dark bread and roasted malts. Flavours of molasses, raisins, caramel, dark bread, roasted malts, a hint of spices and dark chocolate. Taste is medium-heavy sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full bodied, syrupy texture and medium carbonation. HaandBryggeriet Bestefar is strong and sweet, similar to an Imperial Stout. Not a beer that I would serve on a traditional Nordic Christmas dinner table, but as a couch sipper beer it is fine.

Foamed over when opened, probably from bottle conditioning. Pours super dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is of sweet dark malts, spice cake, dried plum, a bit of roast and smoke, coffee, tobacco and slight apple. Taste is brown bread, dried plum, raisin, warm spices, hint of smoke, bit of chocolate and char/roast, and molasses. Medium bitterness. Fizzy carbonation, medium body. Nice alcohol warmth. Starts sweet but finishes fairly dry. This was really nice and complex, I feel like I need to try more to really get a grasp on it but I enjoyed it all the same.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Black with a medium beige/orange head. 
A bit sourish aroma with notes of wood and chocolate. 
Fizzy mouthfeel. 
Dark roasts flavour with liquorice, tar and some sweet, dried fruits. 
Warming alcohol.

Bottled:Pours dark brown with a large, foamy head.Malty, spicy aroma with hints of smoked ham and licorice.Sweet and malty taste with hints of peat, toffee, licorice and some smoke. Bitter and somewhat boozy finish.A bit hard to grasp; flavours takes all kinds of directions.

Bottle at home. Over one year old. Pours a deep brown to black color with a light brown, big head that fades fairly fast. Roasted aroma of chocolate truffles, ash, coffee, smoke, forest and rubber. The flavor has even more of it all; ash, camp fire, coffee and very dark chocolate. Has a silky and slick mouth feel. An incredibly aromatic and tasteful ale with lots of roasted malt, chocolate and camp fire joy. Fantastic and well balanced.
Bottle 50cl. Black with a medium light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt and dark fruits. Medium bittersweet, light sweet with a nice chocolate and roasted end.

(Bottle). Sweet, tangy and fruity nose with aromas of chocolate and dark roasted malt. Big taste of sweet chocolate and with hints of fruit and roasted malt. Extremely bubbly carbonated and way too sticky sweet for my taste.

impressive dense brown head leaves foamhead and lacing. coffee colour. aroma is coffee, chocolate, bit leather, bit smokey, spruce, bit yeasty. taste like aroma, some sweetness like lactose, nice roasted bitterness, boozy with a lasting roasted bitter finish. very nice balance. medium body and carbonation. some slight oxidation notes (nuts, madeira), but still nice anyway. bottle 50cl / bbf jul-2014

500 ml bottle from Systembolaget Passagen, Stockholm.
Almost black body, with a big, not very stable, frothy, dark beige to brown head.
Aroma of melting dark chocolate, nuts, some coffee, some spices.
Taste follows this, with some more dark fruits and slight dry wood.
Full, oily mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes alcohol warming, a bit astringent, roasty, wooden, with dark chocolate, coffee and dark fruits.

Tasty! Like a roasty coffee with liquid bitter chocolate. Pretty filling, but well balanced and quite smooth to drink. A comfortable, warming winter ale!

Bottled, thanks fonefan!  Dark brown, firm rich head. Toasty nose with licorice, marzipan and coffee. Mid dry with full body and rounded mouthfeel. Clover, asphalt, coffee. Warming finish with long herbal bitterness.

Pours dark brown with a massive mocha head. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, cloves and brown sugar. Taste is chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, brown sugar, cloves. Mouthfeel is smooth yet sprightly with medium carbonation.
Bottle from SB. Dark brown with a small beige head. Fruity and smokey tones. Fruit, malt, smoke and caramel. Full body with a bitter sweet / smokey finish.

Pours nearly black and forms a thick tan head with lovely lacing. Smoky aroma of roasted malt, licorice, dried fruit and a hint of what seems to be rutabaga. Full body, oily feel, soft carbonation. Taste of burnt wood and dark roasted coffee with a long and vinous finish of red berries and ash.

Bottle from trade with Meilby- thank you! The beer has got a deep black colour with an steady, beige head and medium body. Aroma of peat, torf and roast. Taste of roasted malt, woods, earth, leaves, spices, light smoke and vanilla. Bitter woody finish with some roasty, smokey hints. Not that easy to drink, yet quite enjoyable and special. Liked it.

Full of dark chocolate, high drinkability and a really full body with some high abv you may notice towards the ends. Roasted malt and that stuff but the chocolate hits the points here. A bit smoky in the finish but all around a good piwo with that special something in.

500ml bottle. Dark brown body with a medium tan head. Spicy and a bit smoky, with flavors of caramel, burnt sugar and roasted malt.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Svart med brunt skum. Doft: Kola, lakrits, choklad likör, rostat, lätt bränt socker. Smak: Lakrits, rostat, kanderat socker, choklad pralin, lite lätt av blandad frukt. Lite för kraftig kolsyrad.
Overall: Sweet complex. Licorice, coffee.Note: Bottle 500 ml at home. Reviewed 2014-12-26.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2016 Bottle at home. Pours dark brown, almost black with small beige head. Aroma of dark bread, caramel, chocolate, coffee alcohol, ashes, smoke, some spices and fruits. Tastes slightly sweet with roasted bitterness. Medium bodied, smooth mouth feel. Nice winter beer.
@ Kristoffers väg. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Chocolate, cacao, some smokiness and spices. Taste: Chocolate, cacao, sweet. Body is medium to light full, chocolate and cacao in the finish.

Pours dark brown to black with tall light beige head. Aroma of hazel nuts, brown sugar, roasty and sweet, light christmas spices. Taste is sweet, malty and spicy with a heavy roasty finish, some burnt sugar. Body is medium to rich, creamy, with soft carbonation.

@ Havregatan 141223. Bottle (500 ml) from Systembolaget. Roasted malty and spicy with caramely notes, chocolate and licorice, vanilla, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is slightly bitter and roasted with chocolate.

Charcoal, smoke, dark malty aroma. Sweetness, fruitiness and strong coffee taste. Incredibly heavy bitterness in the aftertaste that fills the mouth forever. Too much carbonic otherwise the beer was really enjoyable. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Draft at ChurckKey. Poured a clear brown color with a small tan head. Aroma was some cinnamon, cloves. Flavor was sweet malts, light peat. Light alcohol notes.
On draft. Dark brown color with beige head. Grape and smoke aroma. Taste is a lot like a white wine with that grape and some spices. Very different beer and interesting.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Very lively bottle.
Smokey ale with chcolate and some red berries.

Bottle from web SB cons 2014-12-12 Göteborg
AR: caramel, smoked sausages, wee nutty
AP: dark brown reddish/yellow rim, stouthy cream brown steady head
F: round body, wee thai vanilla, wee bubbly carbonation, dark chocolate, coffey - nice brew! 
Marcus: 3,0

500 ml bottle. Pours an orangeish brown-to-black with a resilient beige head. Aroma is roast, coffeeish, spicy and sweet. Flavor is toasty, coffee, dry, spicy (coriander, pepper, nutmeg). Finish is dark coffee grains, very malty. Lingering smoke, alcohol warmth. Medium to full body, velvety mouthfeel, average to strong carbonation. Excellent.
God og fyldig øl med fin farge og skum. Trekk for tynn og kort ettersmak. Anbefales som en øl som kan nytes alene.

Bottled. Pours deep brown with an average tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, smoke and some spice. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry, slightly bitter and with alcohol. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice stout.

Bottle 50 cl.
Clear dark brown, tan head. Nose of roasted malt, and a hint of julmust. Light sweet and bitter. Metallic.
cereal, citrus, golden, amber, hazy, cloudy, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, oily feel, lively,

Very muddy brown, long lasting large tan head, good lacing.
Aroma is sweet, malty, some chocolate and wood.
Flavour is the same as the aroma, some earth.
Bitter mouth, med body, moderate carbonation.
Finishes malty, dirty, some alcohol.
I like this, odd but good.

Black pour under a bit of a foamy/fizzy light khaki head. Rich and deep malty tones of cocoa and spruce with some holiday herbal tones and a dark slightly roasted depth. The flavor is big and smokey, like a rich smoked ale but without any bacon tones, just deep black malt and smoke. Also a wee bitter flavor thats reminiscent of holiday spices and spruce tips. Rich and dark and bitter and smokey yet earthy cocoa tones throughout. Truly a Christmastime by fireplace beer.

Tasting from April 2014.At cellar temperature and into a shallow chalice. Deepest, midnight brown and hazy with very fine and sparse carbonation. Small tannish foam off the pour depletes to just a ring on the meniscus. Rolling it around it cedes legs like that of a tawny port. Nose is bountiful, laden with smoke, rich and deep and hinting at Belgian chocolate, charred dark berries, raisins, muscatels, twiggy bark, fresh strapped leather, marzipan and aniseed - ooooooh yeah!Unabashed dark fruit bitterness in back melds well with the dessert-like folds of chocolate upfront. Strong liquorice and black strap with a little kecap manis and umami, meaty notes. Light, spritzy effervescence on the tip of the tongue, silky and rounded from there on with an oily, heated finish. A touch of ash and smoke lingers long but it is the fruit of this one that is so pronounced. Port-like and vinous as it warms further. This is a long, slow sipper. Absolutely delicious. Another smasher from this brewery!! (50cL, Batch 447, BB 17/02/19, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)

Near black pour with a 3 finger, creamy tan-orange head that has great retention. Aroma of nuts, pine, chocolate, dark fruit, earth and sweet tobacco. Finally a christmas beer that isnt dark brown with a red tint! This one pours a black body, with a light-brown head that sticks around for quite some time before reducing to a very thin layer and a foamy ring that leaves some lacing. The aroma is strong and roasted with coffee, dried dark fruits and faint sweet berries, smoky notes in the back and the usual Haandbryggeriet sour touch. An inviting aroma that isnt that different from the aroma of Nissefar? The taste is moderate sweet and the finish has a rather heavy bitterness bordering to astringent, that combined with a salty liquorice feeling and a strange acidity makes this a bit too rough. A bit of a gusher upon opening uncapping. A large beige tower remains atop the dark chesnut pour forever. Tartish, whether voluntarily or not, gently smokey, very nutty, a bit burnt ale with a leafy, iodine touched late palate bearing the softest bitterness for a beer of its magnitude. Going a bit everywhere after its smooth, silky and neat  Marris Otter mouth entrance. Brown flavours quickly follow, being pushed around by agressive bubbliness which destroy the winter warmer aspirations. While the carbonation contributes to drying the caramel touches out, the gentle acidity feels a bit out of context without any fruitiness to lie unto. 500ml bottle from 2010. Slow gusher but emerges as a menacing jet black with lots of brown foam. Aroma is comprised of roasted malt, chocolate, berry fruit, campfire notes and bonfire toffee. The first thing I noticed was that it was quite thick and viscous on the tongue, but soon I started to pick up on the unexpected minty and peppery flavours that worked very well in this sort of beer. I also expected sweetness but found much more bitterness. Its a good thing I like surprises, so this beer really won me over.

My Bottom Line :  
Roasted malts, prunes, cloves and caramel swirl within this strong ales slender body, leading to peppery hops, chocolate and a rather storyless aftertaste.

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A tower of foam rises atop the darkness.
-This brew needed time to breathe. Incoming infection, or improper bottle conditioning?
-Alcohol warmth appears in the finish.
-Mouthfeel was drier than expected; intense effervescence might have been indicative of something still going on in the bottle?

Medium-bodied with rolling carbonation on the palate.. sourness became tacky in the end.. I didnt really dig it.

50 cl. bottle. Batch 384, 2160 bottles. Pours a medium. lasting, beige, with darker yeast, head, over a hazy, brown/black (SRM 35) body...nose is light coffee, chocolate, sour notes, beef....taste is light coffee, chocolate, sour layers, finishing with cellar, musty, light barnyard notes....mouth feel medium, alcohol hidden, carbonation adds a foamy creaminess. This has many of the appearances, aromas and flavors of an Imperial Stout, but there are many sour, barnyard, cellar, musty layers that lead one away from that well defined style. It is a very different, but interesting beer. BJCP 7/3/14/4/7

2010 bottle pour is dark brownish almost black with off white head, aroma has notes of chocolate, coffee, wet ground and funky notes, hints of lactic sour and a touch of dark fruit in there as well.  Taste is a roasty, chocolate and coffee mixed with some dark fruit, spice notes, touch of funk and sour notes finish this off.  Interesting brew!

The pour is a dark brown with a moderately full, tan, fizzy, frothy head which is mostly diminishing and leaves minimal lace.  The nose is pleasant with dark chocolate, burnt toffee, some campfire smoke, wisps of alcohol, dusty yeast, and roasted almonds.  The flavor is similar with dark chocolate, light raisin, burnt toffee and toast, some light roasted notes and campfire still.  The palate is nearly fizzy in carbonation, nearly full body, and a round, velvety mouthfeel.  The finish is long, still rich and smoky with dark chocolate, light raisin, herbal/smoke coffee notes, and still some nutty tones in there.  This one was interesting, rich with malt but still smoky and roasty background.  The fizzy carbonation was a bit overwhelming for this style of beer but does settle down with some time.  A nice beer to enjoy by the fire in winter.

Bittle, batch 384. Pours black with a tan head. Smells of some funk, lots of chocolate, and some spices and malt. Tastes of a light bitterness, some basement funk, a light sweetness. Medium bodied. Creamy texture. Finishes wet.Not quite my thing.

A dark brew with an off-white head. Nice complexity both in aroma and taste, ranging hints of sourness to chocolatey sweetness. My catch with is that I actually find it a tad too sweet, particularly the finish, but all over, a very well crafted beer. (tap)

On tap at Grünerløkka Brygghus. Dark brown, almost black. Roasty aroma with coffee, dried fruits and hints of spices. Full body. Sweet, with a long lasting aftertaste with some bitterness. Very nice beer for the dark and cold months up north.

On Tap at grünerløkka brygghus. Pours pitch black with a creamy tan head. nose is rich, irish coffee, rum cake, chocolate, dark chocolate covered coffee beans, vanilla, bourbon, everything thats good in life. taste is rich chocolaty, with some roasted highlights. marzipan, chocolate covered cherry cookies, well balanced, an absolute knock out, not too heavy, intensely flavored. I havent rated a beer in a long time, but this beer sort of makes you want to stand on a mountaintop and scream how good it is.

Picked up bottle at Nikkis in RI.  Pours cola colored with nice thick purplish beige head and great lacing.  decent nose of smoke and dark fruits.  tastes of plums, smoke, figs, raisins, roasted coffee beans, cocoa powder and earth.  great carbonation and chalky finish.  very enjoyable sunday afternoon brew

Schokoladenmalziger Antrunk mit sehr leichter Säuerlichkeit, die hervorragend passt und die Malzigkeit ergänzt. Das Bier ist so trotz der Malzlastigkeit erfrischend, ein wenig Anis, Zimt, hefig werdend. Nach und nach wird das Malz leichter, ein leichter Getreidetouch ist vorhanden. Dann wieder schokoladiger, süßlich, vollmundig, unterstützt von mehreren Kräuternoten. 9/12/12/13/9/13
Bottle shared with evanlarkin.  Dark maroon color, small brown head.  Aroma of dark cocoa.  Taste is espresso soda and chocolate syrup.  Very nice.

UPDATED: FEB 29, 2012 Bottle. Deep brown almost black colour with a beige head. Coffee, dark fruit, raisin and orange aroma. Same complex flavour, roasted coffe and barley, raisin, fruity.
The best of Haandbryggeriets seasonal ales.
Tried on tap. Recommended. Traditional christmas beer from haandbryggeriet. Coffee flavor, brown-black apperance and quite bitter. Would enjoy it while relaxing a late December evening.

Keg at CP&K. It pours opaque dark brown, with a thin tan lace. The nose is caramel, chocolate, dark fruit, roasted malt and spice. The taste is cherry, date, blueberry, wood, varnish, alcohol warmth, spice, milk chocolate, meat, vinous notes, brown bread, light roasted malt and caramel, with a dry finish Medium to full body and fine carbonation. Very smooth, well hidden alcohol and malty depth. Interesting stuff.

2010 bottle.
Black, large light brown head with a creamy top.
Aroma: Christmas spices, chocolate, roasted malt, julmust.
Taste: chocolate, julmust, creamy, Christmas spices (orange with cloves), glögg, wood, slightly vinous, sweet and sourish fruitiness.
Full-bodied, smooth, a few small bubbles.
A very nice Christmas beer I would like to have again.
Pours dark, dark brown, close to black. Very small, brown head, which quickly disappears. Quite a lot of carbonation anyways. Roasted coffee, dark fruit, raisin and nutty aroma. Very good beer!

Tap at Paradiso Dupont. Probably getting pours from the end of the keg. Very murky/muddy pour looking completely opaque very massive yeast dreg component. No head formation. Nose is red wine, green olives, small spicy acetic quality and hints of Flemish red oak and wine. Very salty and olive heavy. Taste is like a super thick porter, starting off chalky with big yeast component moving to more silk and powdery chocolate bar. Still gives off hints of lactic sourness and spicy wood/red wine. Not too bad. Would like to re-try in bottle format.

(500ml bottle)  Pours a dark brown body with a moderate tan head.  Aroma of pesticide, spruce, roasted malt, dates, ginger, and chocolate.  Flavor  of roasted malt, char, pine, ginger, chocolate, and wood.

Bottle.  Pours opaque with a large, frothy dark brown head, long retention with fair lacing.  Aroma is dark roast malt, nutty, chocolate malt, light juniper and herbal hops, dark fruity esters and licorice notes.  Flavor is dark malt, light bitterness, spices and juniper, dark fruity esters and a dry finish.  Full body, high warmth, and medium carbonation.

(50cl bottle brewed 6.22.10 bottled 8.3.10 thanks to bu11zeye) near black pour with lasting dark tan head. Nose of cedar, anise, medicinal, chocolate, moth balls. Taste of smoke, medicinal, cedar, very woody and somewhat unpleasant, its too much. Rich chocolate balances it just a bit. Linger is medicinal and woody.

Bottle from Bierkompass. Black color with medium beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel, junipers, smoke. Taste, starts strongly in peppermint, continues with charcoal, toasted malt, hints of coffee. Ends with spicy liquorice finish. Excellent beer for slow drinking.

500ml bottle. Pours with a big crackling fizzy head of fluffy light tan coloured foam. The beer is dark like the colour of tea aznd carries a spiced fruit and dark chocolate aroma. Thin in the body but big on flavour with a velvety smooth mouthfeel. Just like grandfather this is not to be messed with.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2013 Bottle (batch 593).

Head is initially average sized, frothy/fizzy, brown, mostly diminishing.
Body is cloudy dark brown to black.

Aroma is moderately malty (roasted grain, dark chocolate, caramel), with notes of anise, juniper/gin, pepper, nutmeg, spearmint, alcohol.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium to full body, velvety/watery texture, lively carbonation, moderately alcoholic.

Possibly a fresh batch?  No oxidation this time, so probably so.  Very drinkable with a lovely aroma.  A little watery and boozy (and sweet, but still nicely balanced in the finish), but overall a very nice winter warmer.  Spices are evident but very nicely integrated.

(50 cl bottle from BunkerBeer) Pours a clear dark brown with thick, toffee head that laces the glass. Aroma is dominated by fruit, alcohol and caramel. Oily texture, medium carbonation, full body and a sweet, boozy finish. Taste is mostly sweet. Somewhat Belgian in style this beer or perhaps its just the darkness, complexity and high alcohol strength. Girlfriend says: "I like the smokiness."
Geruch röstig und zitrusartig. Antrunk röstig mit zitrusartiger Note. Mitte samtig-schokoladig, kaffeeartig und fruchtig hinterlegt. Abgang bittermalzig, leicht trocken. Sehr schön.

On tap at Gourmet Haus Staudt.  Dark brown, nearly black, pour, with a small tan head that leaves a ring.  Big smoky aroma with roasty and anise notes.  Slight dark chocolate.  The flavor has smoky roasted malts, charcoal, dark chocolate, vinous notes and prune, fig, and toffee.  Medium-full body with carbonation on the lower side.  A nice beer overall, whether you call it an imperial stout or traditional ale or whatnot.

Bottle 500ml from Plonk. Masterpiece, with a unique combination of flavours and aromas. Nose of cherries, apple, and hints of butter. Taste is sweet and sour, with very long length and a dry finish. Palate is silky, with a full body. Black, with a frothy off-white head.

Pours very dark brown in color with a creamy tan head. Nose of dark fruit, chocolate, liquorice, mint and alcohol. Dark fruit more on the taste then spice then vanilla and maybe some ash. Smells thick but tastes thin, complex and different as well as alcoholic.

500ml bottle. Pours an almost opaque red-tinged black, with a huge tan head, which lasts quite well, and leaves behind decent lacing. Dark, sweet aromas abound on the nose, with burnt caramel, treacle, some sweet spice and some lurking lighter fruit notes featuring. Spicy and herbal hops give quite a bitter start to the beer, moving into a dark and bitter body of coffee, supplemented by an almost cola-like sweetness. Berry notes are mixed with bitter herbs in the finish. This is, like so many Haandbryggeriet products, distinctly odd. In many ways it is quite like a stout, but much more herbal in taste, and a bit lighter in feel. It doesnt quite hit the mark in the way that some of their other efforts do, although it is still a very interesting and quite a rewarding beer. I cant, however, see myself drinking it often.

500 ml. bottle shared by Tmoney99.  Pours very dark brown in color with a large creamy tan head.  The aroma is full of herbs and spices, spruce, roasted malt, a hint of chocolate and wood.  The flavor has juniper, herbs and spices, roasted malt, chocolate and a touch of wood.  Some alcohol works its way in toward the finish.  Interesting brew.
Bottle courtesy bu11zeye. Pours a clear dark brown color with some reddish tints. Fizzy tan head. Aroma is dry, nutty and slight spice. Flavor is dry bread, caramel notes, and malts. Dry finish.

500 ml.; bottled 03 Aug 2010. Opaque ebony with a lasting disc of foam. Nose of chocolate, raisin, licorice, plum. Taste is dark fruit, oats, cherry, chocolate-chip cookie dough, spicy evergreen (juniper?), citrus, mint, tobacco, soy sauce, and alcohol. Incredibly complex. Medium-heavy body is watery, much too fizzy, but well-balanced and drinkable, with a nice warmness.

Big tan frothy head dark pour mild carbonation aromas dark fruit liquorice coffee plums sultanas gingerbread cinnamon raisin flavour cinnamon liquorice raisin bitter is mild nutmeg touch gingerbread spicy notes vanilla pod taste yeasty dough touch caramel finish dark fruit malts sweet spicy christmas tastes abound good tasting
bottled, thanks to bu11zeye, dark brown pour with soapy foam, spruce/pine aroma with a woody spruce, malt and roast flavor

Bottle shared with esp0r. 
All black with big brown head. 
Roasty aroma with juniper, nuts, chocolate. Yum. 
Spiced taste of malts, dried fruit, coffee. Nice body, good bitterness, and a warm feel.

Bottle with the white label shared with Daje
Pitch black, thick espresso head. Perfume, nuts, prunes and roasted malts in the aroma. Full malt body with good sweetness. Finish is good and hoppy. Another nice beer from Haandbryggeriet. I hope i can enjoy one or two of these next winter

500ml Bottle - Dark brown with a haze. Liquorice, aniseed, chocolate and roasted malt in the aroma. The taste is roasted and slightly sharp with notes of liquorice, plain chocolate, roasted malt and coffee. Complex, yet very easy to drink.

Bottle. A steady, brown head forms as the dark brown, next to black beer fills the glass. Nice lacings occur as I sink it. Wehn poured, a nice spiced and roasted scent spreads, and a deeper inspection reveals faint notes of licorice, rather anise maybe, smoke and dark chocolate. As it warms up, I took it right from the fridge, some molasses aroma escapes the glass, followed by juniper and a faint alcohol touch. Its too sweet on the palate I think. Not too much sweet, but too sweet anyway. Molasses, licorice, roasted and burnt notes as well as a spiced touch and warming alcohol coates the mouth, before the bubbles try to clean it up. Its a quite heavily carbonated beer, especially considering the body fullness and ABV, and that is a bit negative on the drinkability. Not that its supposed to be a thirst quencher drank in mass glasses, but its nevertheless too carbonated. The alcohol finally get to show off in the finish, where it gives that lovely calm and relaxed feeling a night cap beer should give. I dont know if its supposed to serve this kind of purpose, it will be equally well suited with some nuts and dried fruits late Christmas eve, or with a good book in your favorite chair, preferrably by the fire in the dark time of year. To sum it up, Ive been a bit reluctant to try this one. I have no idea why, but when I finally dared I found a well crafted, tasteful and pleasant beer that I most certainly wont hesitate to have again. 110629

Pours nice black colour with a faint brown head. Strong malty aroma, chocolate, coffee and caramel notes. Medium to almost high sweetness and medium bitterness in the taste. Coffee and dark chocolate together with some roasty malty notes in the taste. Maybe some dry fruits and smokiness too. Full body, creamy, soft carbonation and a smokey light bitter finish with the flavour of the malts on the mouth. Very good.

Oh boy, what a beer! Pours with a large, thick, creamy, foamy, frothy, tan head with brown highlights that settles right down to a ring around the edge of the glass and no lace. Color is an opaque very dark brown. Aroma is complex with different spices, malts, cocoa, roasty, and toffee. Flavor is very similar and adding to that some fruitiness and some bittersweet flavors. Lots going on. Body is excellent and so is carbonation. Finish is a little boozy and fairly long with almost all the characteristics hanging tough. Good sipping beer although its good enough to take some mouthfulls, but the alcohol gets a little too bold. So, not quite a session brew.

Bottle courtesy of heyta. Initially poured from a 16.9-ounce bottle at fridge temperature into a Mikasa tulip and allowed to warm. 

Pour yields a brew that is nearly black. Foam immediately shoots up to form a dense light mocha head with good lasting power, as it stays at a half-finger for most of my session with it. Some spotty lacing on the edges of the glass. The nose carries a good amount of wintry spice and what seems like a bit of juniper. The flavor is a nice combination of juniper and what seems similar to clove, if not that itself. A bit of roast there as well and a nice chocolate presence. Medium to full body with low-to-medium carbonation. Solid brew. A nice nearly-Summer treat.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-16-2011

0.5l bottle @ Øl & Matfestivalen 2011, Oslo. Have been looking forward to trying this for quite some time now, thou I must admit that tasting this outside, mid-June in a park when its 26° was initially not how I intended to taste this for the first time, but right now I couldt care less. Here we go: Pours a deep deep brown near black body with some big dark sediments and a small lasting chocolate head. Aroma is surprisingly hopy and of course quite malt-roasty with some nice dark fruits, hints of smoke and something that my imaginations tells me is junipers(but its most likely not...). Lively carbonated, has a sticky oily mouthfeeling and can only be described as medium- to full-bodied. The flavors are not quite what I had expected; Tastes sweet-fruity with a dark and salty licorice twist. I also find some notes of smoke in the taste, but quite subtle. Perhaps a little leather in here as well, and in the end the typical Haandbryggeriet yeast-profile kicks in as it often does in their dark brews. Really pleased with this one!

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours dark brown with some red tinges. A small, slightly tanned head is produced. Aromas of dark and dried fruits - raisins are the most prominant, a little alcohol and some molasses. Loads of plum and raisins in the taste, with a lingering warmth of alcohol. Decent and definitely a winter warmer

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2011 murky reddish brown almost absorbs all light. HUGE beige head. loads of tar (Tervaa) on flavour. rye bread. Sweet light espresso. a bit of aroma of a sweet smoky whisky. Quite sweet flavour. a bit sticky and dryish  end. slightly bitter too. heavy full mouthfeel. This is a good beer. Perfect for enjoying as it is.

Bottle dated 03Aug2010.  Pours a mostly opaque brown body with red tinges around the edges and a light brown foam head.  Aroma of sweet malt, clove, and light smokiness along with a spicy perfume that smells an awful lot like cleaning supplies.  Flavor of chocolate roasted malts with a strong spice note up front.  Nice smoky roasted malt finish.
Bottled 50cl. Ordered from www.erzbierschof.ch. Dark appearance. Full to medium bodied. Plenty of character. A lot ginger throughout. Nice.

Bottle. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is sour, roasted malt, smoked, coffee, chocolate. Flavour is sourness, roasted malt, smoked, coffee, sugar, hop, fruit, raisin, chocolate, spices. Full body. Nice beer.

Born under the Taurus sign, this beer was destined for the throne. Two generations of men born and bred in good faith have passed away under its rule, and it is now reigning over the third. "Give the Bestefar an inch and itll take a light-year," ejaculated brewmaster Sam Waterston upon concocting this she-devil of a libation. But would you trust a thrice-convicted dynamite fisherman? Methinks not. The Bestefar may sound like a carnival, but it smells like a beer. I am not at liberty to discuss the aroma any further than this. I am, however, free to discuss the properties of its appearance as much as necessary. Its a dark looking beer. The aroma? New car, musty doghouse, Islam, ammonia, and cliffs of dover. The taste? Otherworldly. That is to say it tastes earthy. The Bestefars got more rhymes than the church got "ooh lords." The aftertaste reminds me of a Yom Kippor I once spent pondering my mortality in a diminutive Albuquerque prison cell, despite having a duration that is as short as the night is long. Find the Bestefar in your local supermarket, adjacent to the womens shoes on sale in aisle 3.

Bottle.  Very dark brown pour, almost black, with a tan head.  Sweet dark malts, juniper, clove, light earthy smoke, pine needles, and dark berries.  I found it to be a very nice winter ale, would be great on a cold winter day.
Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is smoke,fruity, and  floral. Flavor is fruity, ashy smoke, toffee, light bitterness.

Shared bottle at Cardinal. Deep ruby verging on black body with a brown, creamy head. Spicy, roasted, berries, black currant, juniper and cardamum on the nose. Acidic, alcoholic, sweet and bitter flavors with notes of smoke, roasted barley, dried fruits and band aid. Full body. Dryish finish.

Bottle: &nbsp Deep brown, nearly black, large light brown frothy head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Strong juniper nose, a little herbal/bushy. &nbsp Its almost so strong that it gets too perfumy. &nbsp Reminds me a bit of a urinal cake, unfortunately. &nbsp Does seem to have a bit of clove as well. &nbsp On the tongue its a little overpowering, juniper, evergreen, and a general forest/bushy presense. &nbsp Seems to me that it needs something to counteract the strong herbal aroma and flavor. &nbsp Moderate to full body and mouthfeel. &nbsp  Getting some salty black licorice and holly bush  at the finish. &nbsp Really flavorful, but hard to drink.

25-APR-2011, bottle, batch 312, a gift from Henrik.
I open my "cellar" and grab for an easter brew, but hits this one. The bottle touches the wall, and gives of a slight hiss. Hmm! Needs to drink this today, so i bring it to an easter party.
Almost black, huge huge head that dies quickly. In the glass it keeps bubbling...
Heavy sediment falls to the bottom of the bottle.
Nose is ginger...
...some smoke, coffee, well espresso. Citric notes on all the malty stuff.
It has a huge huge carbonation. Keeps bubbling in the mouth. Too much.
I am not a ginger fan but apart from that and the carbonation, I really like this.

Aroma: herbs, fruit/banana, salmiak, ginger, light smoke, red meat, a deep dark malty aroma. has a twisted sweetness to it with a bit of salt at the side. Apperance: Strong dark thick liquid. the bottle is standard nice haand, although looks a bit cheap.. Fits the line they have chosen. Takes 6min to pour. Very bubbly foam, guess it comes with the carbonation.. settles down nicely and has a solid slim foam that stays until the end. Looks indeed like a good dark winter ale. Palate: surprisingly high carbonation, has a stingy character settling into the mouth. Might be because of that carb. could do with less. but it nicely works. the tastes settle nicely where they belong and the mouth gets to work hard enough. Overall: reminds me of Prykmestars Savu Kataja, except with less meaty/bacon tastes and a bit more of that fruityness. pleasantly surprised, and consider this to be probably the best dark ales from haand.
Dark brown body, light brown head. Aroma of smoke, juniper, burned sugar and alcohol. Flacvour has fruits, cola, cardamno, cinnamon, smoke and chocolate. Full bodied, oily, nice bitterness.

Bottle. Blackish beer with a tan head. Chocolate and light roast aroma. Malt and toffee flavor with light licorice and light chocolate. Medium bodied. Malt and light roast lingers with light chocolate and light licorice.

Bottle: hazy brown/red colour, with à nice creamy brown head. Aroma is fruity,,ashtry,smokey,tar, some vanilla in the end. Flavor is smokey, tar ashtry,salty,lakris,raisins. Medium body, medium to long smokey/Vanilla finish!
