UPDATED: DEC 10, 2011 Bottle @ home. Pours a dark brown/black body with a creamy brown head. Mint, juniper, and various spices over dark malts in the nose. Even a slight hint of ginger in the aroma. Dark bitter malty body that has a significant piney hoppiness, somewhat funky flavor with hints of various spices such as mint, juniper, and ginger. Funky brew.

Bottle. Pours a dark bruin body with a large tan coffee toned head with modest retention.  Aromatically sharp fruit tones and spices.  Cinnamon, pepper tones, cloves, brown sugar, toffee and dark malts.  Smooth bodied but intensified by the sharp spicy tones and modest warming.  Nice offering.

Bottled 500ml (Alko Arkadia, brygget 170910, batch 312)
Dark brown color, huge brown fluffy head, lace. Strong aroma of clove and ginger. Very foamy, carbonated mouthfeel. Liquerish. Licorice, some spices (clove), sweetish black toffee in the flavor. Likeable flavor. Finish has light hops and alcohol too. Very personal beer, which would be more pleasant with less carbonation.
Bottle. Pours black. Tan head. Nose of juniper twigs, tobacco, clove, raisin brown sugar and spruce. Taste of clove, juniper, brown sugar and raisin.

50cl bottle.  Large tan head atop brown-black body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, tobacco, roast, some maple, juniper, raisin, light anise.  Taste is moderately sweet, raisin, roast, some tobacco, bakers chocolate, light maple.  Medium body, some effervescence, alcohol well contained.  I have no idea what the brewer was aiming for here, but its a tasty treat that seems ideal for a cold winter night.

Bottle. Poured dark brown color with an average frothy brown head that was mostly lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted malt and juniper and resin aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted sweet and herbal flavor with medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate duration. Solid complex beer.

20110301  50cl bottle from State Line.  Deep dark brown with frothy brown head that lasts.  Aroma is minty, menthol, along with toasted sage, tobacco, maple, pine cone, light toffee notes.  Lovely full palate with a pleasing oiliness that lasts and holds some herby acidity that is complemented by a firm, even carbonation and light alcohol pepperiness.  Im a big fan of Haands rustic and herbal brews and this one is right there with some of my favorites.  Its great when nobody else buys them and they end up going on sale at the local good beer stores just to make shelf space, and Ill be watching for that inevitable with this one for sure.

Bottle, bottled on 03 Aug 2010, Total Bottles 2160. Poured a dark brown color with a large sized tan head. Aromas of roast, spices, dark fruits, and a little earthy. Tastes of roast, spices, chocolate, licorice, and vanilla.

,5L bottle from fonefan

The aroma and flavor of this beer are spicy, in the Christmas sort of way. Theyre balanced with a touch of dark chocolate in the flavor and a dry finish. This drinks very nicely. The flavor is unique and very enjoyable.

Bottle from Beverages 4 Less in Santee. Pours black with a 3 finger foamy tan head. Aroma is juniper, all-spice, a lot of that xmasy stuff. Full body. Flavor is juniper, xmas spice/herb, some chocolate, smooth burntish malt, and a hint of anise in the finish.
Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours black with a thick tan head and a treacle cookie aroma. There is a rich treacle and coffee flavor with a little anise.and a dry bitter finish. Very tasty.

Bottle. 16.9 oz. Split with James and Dallas. Courtesy of Dallay. Pours a deep, heavy mahogany with a wispy, thin, tan head. Moderate lacing. Aroma of dark, ripe fruits--plums, figs, and dates--spruce, clove, and roasted malts; also slight notes of jasmine, fennel, and licorice. Medium to fuller bodied with a roasty, spicy, yet sweetly suave and smooth mouthfeel. Tastes sort of like an oddly sweet, subtle Smoked. Good stuff. Thanks Dallay!

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2011 Bottle split with Pat and Dallas. Pours a dark, dark brown body with thin light brown lacing.  Aroma is slightly smoky, fruity, raisin, and sour notes. Mouthfeel is spicy with notes of dark fruits, clove, raisin, molasses, jasmine, and finishes tart.

Bottle with Pat and James. Pours a pitch black with a light tan head. smell is incredibly floral, almost perfumey. Taste is a molasses base with tons of spices. Vegetable flavors are prominent. Very cool.

0.5 l bottle at Vihreä Haltiatar, Jyväskylä. Dark brown almost black color, very foamy. Sweet roasty and perfumed spicy aroma. Sweetish, roasty and spicy flavor with pungent anise and licorice note as well as some chocolate. Full body. Anise flavor is too dominant.

dark brown, smootjh light yellow head.
spicy aroma,  sweet malty,  roasted stuff.
very nice flavor roasted stuff withadded anise flavors and other spices. taste is really good.
Bottled. Black coloured. Dense brown head. Aroma is medical and spiced. Has a flavour of spice, light roast sweetness and medicin. Medium bodied. Dry spiced and vague smoked end.

Botte 50 cl. Courtesy of yngwie. Pours a pitch black with a dense light brown head. Hard roast malt aroma with some ginger and spice. Solid body, sweet roast malts, again ginger and spice with some roast and vanilla in the finish. 130211

A: Pours a very dark brown color with a finger of tan head forming.

S: Theres a huge herbal aroma coming from this. Seems like a ton of sage. Quite a lot of pine and spruce to the nose, as well. Some definite roast and maybe a bit of chocolate.

T: A weird combination of floral and herbal flavors. The same intense sage flavor is there along with spruce and some tart berries. Dark chocolate and roasted malt character is present too.

M: The body is medium with a moderate level of carbonation.

D: A little too funky for me. I wanted this to be good, but I couldnt really get into it.

Dark brown, almost black. Big, dense spongey head. Smells like chocolate and molasses, with some spicy (cinnamon?) and red wine notes. Flavor is a lot of chocolate and coffee, with odd spicy notes in the background. Very heavy palate. Definitely a sipper...

State Line Liquors tasting.   Pours a very dark opaque brown color with a one finger tan head that has good retention and nice lacing.  Aroma of fresh cut spruce needles with some chocolate and roasted hints.  Big hit of piney bitterness and roast upfront followed by a mix of sage, ginger, nutmeg, chocolate and asmoked fruitiness. A well carbonated beer with a dry finish. Medium bodied.

Bottle, bought @ Barley Wine, Cph.
Pours black with a giant, creamy, light-beige head. Fizzes slightly. Very complex aroma, lots of chocolate, nuts, milky, coriander, holly, mildly vinious, a bit of cinnamon. Medium, prickly carbonation, fairly light and well creamy palate. Flavour is mildly roasted, good chocolate, mild cinnamon dryness, some herbal touches, nuts, nutmeg, bog myrtle, light ashy, some tobacco. Fairly sweet, but also with some good dryness. Quite the elegant beer.
Bottle; Pours dark black/brown, tan head. Aroma of malt, yeast, coffee/chocolate.  Flavor is burned malts, chocolate.  Thinnish.  Good beer. Alcohol is present but not overpowering.
Pours very dark with a high brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, spices, and coffee. Flavor is malts, alcohol, spices, and various other flavors I cant recognize. Good stuff.

500ml Bottle:  Complex aroma of malt, yeast, chocolate, light spice, light roasting, dark fruit, chocolate-covered fruit, and cardamom.  Poured pitch black in color with a huge, creamy, dense, tan/brown head that diminished slowly but lasted throughout.  Opaque.  Complex flavor is medium sweet.  Tastes of malt, spice, chocolate, juniper, chocolate-covered fruit, light yeast, and a hint of nuts.  Medium body.  Slightly thin, then slightly chalky texture.  Average carbonation.  Malt, chocolate, spice, light yeast finish is slightly chalky.  9%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

500 ml bottle. Batch #312. Finland.
Dark reddish brown colour with huge tan head.
Roasted malt, cardemon and some xmas spices in aroma.
Roasted malt, coffee, smoke, dark fruits, caramel and ripe banana in flavour. 
Warming.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2011 Pours a brown, three-finger head that fades quickly leaving traces of lace. Black color, no highlights, ton of yeast left in bottle. Light-medium carbonation and medium bodied. Oak, chocolate nose, flavor is oak and sweet baked chocolate, higher ABV is hidden.  Really good winter ale. Expensive at $11.50 for a 500ml bottle from Tullys Beer & Wine Wells, Me.

Nose: Large and perfumed. Rosemary, cardboard and lots of blueberries.
Taste: Very komplex beer with blueberries, salt, some coffee and liquorish.
Kinda strange beer and I am having a hard time trying to figure out what they are trying to achieve.  The after taste it pure bluberry and kinda ruff after a while.
Bottle @BBF 2010 shared with the guys from Haandbryggeriet (they are crazy-awesome...)! Nice dark pour - the biggest note was overtones of cardamom - interesting and easy to drink!

Bottle from West Lakeview. Pours black with a deep brown head. Nose is tar, molasses, spice and fruit wild notes. There is the distinct Haand character in this one. On taste, slightly phenolic and a hint smoky. The roast level is nice and balancing with some pleasant alcohol notes. Finish is pretty dry, but not overly so. A bit woody and anise like as well. Pretty interesting beer that Id love to give another go to.
Very tasty and complex, still well balanced beer. Strong aroma, "smells like a rotten peach" as my girlfriend said it. Must be enjoyed slowly enough.
50cl, new Norwegian brew Anno 2010, from Brouwerij de Molen Bodegraven, complex brew, very spicy, yet balanced, hazy, good head, good Winter brew, yet expensive!

Bottled. Very dark brownish color, big mocca head. Aroma is packed with stuff; roasted malts, coffee, spruce and liquorice. The beer is surprisingly light bodied and a bit rough around the edges. The alcohol is a bit pungent. Would probably be better after a year of aging.
Bottled. Pours cola-like dark with a quickly dissappearing tan head. Taste is medium bitter, a bit tart. Palate is very carbonated and foamy. Aroma has woods, smoke, coffee notes.
Bottle, brewed 22.06.10. Finally, a beer from Handbryggeriet that is not to fizzy! This is a successful seasonal beer, which I enjoyed in front of my fireplace, freezing cold outside.
At Borefts BF 2010.  Black with thin tan head.  Spiced beer, some ginger.  Over carbonated from teh bottle.  Bit thin in body.  Too much spice for me.

500ml bottle, batch 312. Noisy, tan coloured, medium sized head covering a body that is black as pitch. Inviting smell of earthy malts, dark fruits and lighter notes of spices. Complex taste profile with expression of anise, dark fruits, dark malts and dried orange shells that provide a fresh bitterness to the ending. Naturally carbonation. Almost full bodied. Nice on a dark Christmas eve. (Yuletide present from Finn, cheers mate, Tromsø 25.12.2010).

Black color with a medium head.  Heavy aroma on cloves, juniper, spruce, and chocolate.  Very sprucy flavor.  Milder allspice.  A bit ashy and bitter malt.  Light chocolate.  Fairly strong on the carbonation.
Very dark brown with a lasting tan head. Intense and perfumed aroma of spices and herbs. Sweet herbal and spicy flavour with licorice and malt. Juniper is prominent
500 ml bottle. Pitch black colour, huge beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and dark fruits. The flavour is roasted, spicy, with liquorice, coffee and chocolate. Smooth and very tasty.

50cl bottle. Black with a huge foamy tan head. Roasty aroma with notes of juniper, dark chocolate and spices. Lots of juniper in the flavour with some roasted malt, dark chocolate, slight bitterness and spices. Medium-bodied, bitter and sweet finish.

Pungent. The alcohol is present on the nose but accompanied by black licorice which helps mellow it out. The appearance is bold. Black but with a surprisingly lighter head of rich brown bubbles. Sticky lacing. The taste is unique. Im not a huge black licorice fan so it threw me off a little bit but flavors of toffee and vanilla contribute to create a pleasing combination. Overall I couldnt get over the licorice flavor but that doesnt mean it isnt a beautifully crafted brew. Perfect for this time of year.

This was really different. Pours a very dark brown with a big brown creamy head which laces the glass. A beautiful beer as you will see. The aroma is spruce, pine, cola, some booze. The flavor has the same with a lot of chocolate and some Christmas spices as well. A very long lasting after taste makes this one of my favorite Christmas beers to date.

Bottle Murky, dark brown ale with a mid-sized, creamy, khaki head. Good retention. The spicy, rooty bouquet supplies notes of cola, sassafras and chocolate. Medium to full-bodied and creamy with subdued carbonation. The flavor is a sweet, chocolaty merger of cocoa, cola and root beer. Bittersweet, warming finish. Bottle courtesy of darkguardian!

Bottled @ Hilpeä Hauki. Appearance is black with very thick head. Aroma feels like standing near a dying embers, plenty of roasted malts and dark grapes. Taste is long and great, with roasted malts, winelike grapes, chocolate, some apple and warming alcohol.

bottle.  murky black under a small dark tan head.  aroma of mint chocolate chip ice cream.  flavor is chocolaty with mint and herbs.  not sure whats in this but it tastes like wintergreen and chocolate.  medium-full body.  very different.
Opaque dark brown with a fluffy tan head.  Aroma and taste of chocolate, fruit, and ginger bread.
Bottle 50 cl. Poured dark colour with a beige head. Aroma is burnt coffee and roasted malts. Flavour is a little less burnt coffee with some roasted notes. A very smooth and tasty beer.

Bottle.  Pours a lovely oily near black with a great head, love it.  Aroma has a nice old ale note with medium spices.  Flavor follows but becomes more dominated by spicing as it goes, light leather, chocolate, anise, and lots of juniper, pretty nice.

Bottle thanks to 17thfloor for sharing. Pours almost black with a small creamy tan head. Aroma is very spicy plenty of dark fruit with some sweet candy notes. The spices are on the forefront though, some cinnamon and star anise. Flavor starts with the spice the anise/licorice candy coming out. The fruit and chocolate notes come out in the finish, very smooth, no bitterness. Medium to medium full creamy and a soft carbonation. Good stuff here

500ml bottle from Alko Arkadia

Pours black with a massive, long-lasting beige head. Strong aroma has hints of caramel malt and syrup. Taste is a strange mix of sweetness, syrup and caramel malts. Alcohol is well hidden. Unbalanced beer.

1.9 fl oz. Pours a deep dark brown with a huge frothy dark tan head. A strong intresting aroma of dark fruit, nuttiness, a bittersweet dark chocolate notes. Chocolate mocha flavors a nice candied fruit bitterness that kicks up. A dry almost tart fruit finish that sticks around. Love the Haand stuff.
Pours black but not pitch black.  Weird aroma that the flavor confirms is BBQ.  But also getting a load of spice notes as well.  Cinammon maybe.  Alcohol packs a load at the tail end.
Pours black into a shaker. Mocha head with excellent retention recedes to coat surface. Chocolate aromas. Earthy chocolate and anise upfront turning mocha in the lasting finish.

Bottle. Very dark brown, average fully diminishing head. Moderate sweetish and very spicy aroma (aniseed and coriander, some licorice). Body is medium to full, sweetish and very spicy flavor (just as in aroma). Finish is average, very spicy and dryish. Overly spiced beer.

Huge brown-beige head, irregular, over near-black beer. Medicinal nose, with pine, lavendar, cypress; roasted & dark malts, bathsalts. Roasted malts, faintly coffeeish, dominate the other flavours, featuring again the lavender/pine-like notes. Pretty carbonated feel, masking more velvety texture; medium to well-bodied, some alcoholwarming. Aftertaste is more balanced than the main taste, flavours better integrated. They seem to like their spices at H.B. I find it hard to believe all those aromatics are just yeasteffects.

Bottle at ÖBWF 2010. It poured a pitch black liquid with a small brown head. Smell of chocolate and coffee. Taste of chocolate, coffee, nuts, oranges and other spices. Semi-smooth mouthfeel with a thick body. Well balanced and complex. Nice Christmas beer.

Bottle from Fred at Beverages 4 Less.  Live rate!  Pours coffee in color with a frothy mocha head.  Smells of Polo cologne, juniper berries, cherry cough syrup, and smoked malt.  Looks way better than it smells.  Tastes of pine sap, caramel, barley, licorice, and faint cocoa.  Good, but certainly hard to get past the aroma.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2015 Draught @ Gastropuben KICK Malt & Mat, Kristiansand
Pours dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, smoke, caramel, chocolate and dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long slightly warm, smoked, ash, chocolate, coffee, fruity and caramel finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma and taste has notes of roasted malts, coffee and chocolate [7 4 8 4 17 - 4.0 11/25/2010 ]

(Bottled) Very dark brown with a large, beige and bubbly head. Strong aroma of dried fruit, juniper, syrupy maltiness, yeast. Flavor is yeasty, tarry, berryish, coffeeish, and worty-roasted-malty with burnedness in the finish. Medium body, foamy CO2, surprisingly thin after the aroma. Initially very homebrewish, quite thin and burned. Clearly better after shaking the excess CO2 away, and warming up a bit - but still not close to the 4.0 mark. 4345

500ml bottle generously shared by Doug, thanks man  
Appearance: Dark brown with a medium sized tan head and some lacing 
Aroma: Spruce, roasted malts and spices 
Taste: Roasted malts with a slightly bitter finish 
Nice sipping beer

Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Valkendorfsgate, Bergen. Near-black brown body, big but fast disappearing caramel head. Aroma is fruity, with lots of black currants and dried fruits alongside hints of spices and dark malts. Taste is surprisingly mellow for such a high, dark ABV beer from Haandbryggeriet: dark malts, oats, wood, black currants and hints of leather and smoke. A bit of sourness going on as well, almost like wild yeast or Belgian oud bruin or something; cant really put my finger on it. Very mild though, and very well integrated. Not the regular Haandbryggeriet yeastiness so often dominating their dark brews, Bestefar could be one of their real Christmas winners. I think it will be even better with a bit of storage, so maybe I should get me one bottle for next Christmas? Anyways, this is good stuff.

500 ml bottle thanks to CLevar. A cool label. Pours a very dark brown color with a large light brown head. The aroma is massive spruce, some roast and chocolate. A very nice original flavor; huge pine/spruce, some earthy chocolates, roasted malts, lively.

Bottle (50cl) from Vinmonopolet (Storo), Oslo. Batch 312 (BB 17.9.2012). Huge beige head, reducing fairly rapidly, producing large bubbles, settling to a stable ring, no lacing. Opaque, dark brown colour. Sweet, spicy, roasted malt aroma with nutmeg, cardamom, sweet licorice, coffee, juniper berries, smoke. Medium-to-full body, average-to-fizzy carbonation. Mouthfeel is lighter than ABV would suggest. Good hop bitterness in the finish with the sweetness balanced by dry licorice and coffee. Perfect to enjoy in front of the fireplace.

Fra Vinmonopolet Langnes. Svart. Høyt mokkafarget luftig skum som detter sakte. Svak kaffearoma. Myk munnfølelse. Krydder. Litt frukt. Nøtter. Harpiks. Innholdsrikt & godt. Alkoholen godt kamuflert.  KI=6

Pours a deep brown with a chocolate sponge cake head. The aroma is very English, packed with maltiness, and the flavour also has an English profile. Some smokinmess, junipher twigs, licquorice. Wheat malt giving some softness. A little sour smoke. Caramel, charcoal, vintage port. A complex beer for slow sipping.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours very dark brown with a big beige head. Smoked aroma followed by smoked and fruity flavours. Some caramel sweetness as well as liquorice. Noticeable alcohol. This rauchbier is a bit too sweet for my taste, but the liquorice/juniper is nice.

Sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2010. Pours a pitch black beer with a weak offwhite head. The aroma is malt, sweetness, star anis and spices. The flavor is malt, sweetness, some roasted notes and spices. The palate is sweetness with some bitterness. Overall a good beer.

Bottle to snifter.  Black with a light brown head that fades to a nice layer and sticks around, minimal lacing.  Quite a nice looking beer.  Aroma is very interesting, in a good way.  Some spice notes, juniper, light malt tones, perhaps a bit of alcohol? Taste is more juniper, burnt malt, wood.  Palate falls a bit flat, almost slick on the tongue, doesnt really work with the flavors.  Overall though, a really good beer.  No trouble finishing this one!  Have to get more for over New Years at the cabin

500 ml bottle (Malteinen Riekko, Helsinki)
6 Big mixed bag here. Liquorice, hoppy bitterness, some bark
5 Black, healthy tan head.
7Full taste, huge liquoricey taste bucketloads of doughy and burnt burnt malts.
5- super-full palate, perhaps a bit slimy or sticky, which is why the - sign appears against my 5. Finish very burnt, and som burnt chrismas cake stodginess too.
15 Great late evening sipper, one bottle should keep 3 people amused. Nice level of winter "spiciness", mostly liquorice.
Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, coriander, fruity notes and staranise. Flavour is roasted malt, alcohol, chocolate,liquorish, fruity notes and high alcohol.

Bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours deep black with a tiny tanned head.Aroma is heavy malty, vinous and dark fruits. Taste is moderate sweet malts, dark fruit and easy coffee, some liquorice notes as well towards the finish. Smooth mouthfeel. Another good beer from Drammen

Bottle @ 2e BBF. A black colored beer, with a beuge head. The aroma is spicy, there are juniper. Also some bitterness. The taste is spicy with juniper, laurel and dark fruits. The aftertaste is dry with bittersweet.

Bottle 500ml. @ Borefts Bier Festival 2010, Brouwerij de Molen, Overtocht 43, Bodegraven, Netherlands.Clear dark brown color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, pine needles, flowers - soap. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration, licorice. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100924]

25th Spetember 2010. Borefts Beer Festival II. Opaque black beer. Massive creamy head. Sweet dark malt. Lightly spiced and pleasantly so. Not bitter or dry. Crisp palate. Very drinkable spiced beer. All too often the spice is overdone - here it enhances.

Big darkish brown head. Opaque  black body. Fruity spicy cinnamon ginger aroma with [unreadable] notes. Lovely harmony. Dry-sweet spicy cinnamon ginger and licorice taste with peppery notes. Mild, soft mouthfeel. Full body. Dryish-sweet roasty oily chocolatey aftertaste with resiny gingery notes. Really, really nice. Im going to buy lots of this for Christmas. (0.5l bottle, bottled 2010-08-03.)

50cl bottle. Brewed 2010-06-22. Pitch black colour. Small head. Aroma is roasted coffee, barley,wheat and hints of yeast. Flavour is rich and a tad bitter. Smokey. Yeast. Malty. Roasted coffee. Long, lingering aftertaste.

Bottle shared by OleR. Thanks! Pours black with reddish brown highlights and a creamy light brown head. Aroma is, as often with spiced beers, a bit soapy. Not much though. A bit floral, some chocolate and coffee notes, herbal notes, liquorice, dark fruits, spices. On the tongue, the spices go almost peppery. Very spiced. Something reminds me a bit of evergreen too, which makes me think of Beer Here Mørke Pumpernickel Porter, and thats definitely a good thing. Carbonation is gentle and creamy, body is pretty thick. I really liked this one, its cozy in a way.

(Bottle, bottling date 3.8.2010, at Maltainen Riekko, Helsinki) Apperance was like from a stout: nearly black and large, light brown head. Aroma was quite spicy and it resembled a cough mixture. It was still pleasant and again I found fennel. Flavours were quite close to each other eg. roastedness, chocolate but there was also herbal spices and fennel seeds. Sometimes spiciness is too off-putting but the combinations in this beer did work. Finishing the 0.5 litre bottle all by myself was quite easy.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2015 Re-rate 1/15: Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Stas. Brown with a tan head. Roast, chocolate, a bit of dark fruits, bittersweet, a bit of licorice, a light acidic touch, an alcoholic touch. 7/4/6/3/13=3.3

[9/24/10]  Draught at Borefts Beer Festival 2010. Black with a light brown head. Roasty aroma with some coffee and dark fruits. Sweet, slightly roasted flavor with brown sugar, malt, fruits and chocolate hints. Medium to full-bodied. 7/4/6/3/13=3.3

Bottled. Very deep brown colour, small off-white head. Aroma is clove, some alcohol, some malts and quite yeasty notes. Flavour is enormous smoked wet wood, spices, alcohol and some quite malty and stinging notes.

Bottle @ BBF. Aroma is peat, liquorice and spice with a medicinal and herbal sidenote.
Flavour is deep liquorice and peat extract with iodine and a earthy fruity sour note. Some herbs. Smooth and intense.
Bottle @ 2nd BBF. Dark brown colour, off-white bubbles. Aroma is roasted malts and sour fruits. Flavour of sour fruits and roasted malts, and a bit of licorice.

at De Molen festival 2010 ... deep black ... thin tan head ... rich roast toffee ... chocolate malts ... little light cheesy hop nose ... soft smooth rich body ... light bitter ... dark roast ... little raisins ... little sandle wood

500 ml bottle, courtesy of Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 9%, IBU 28. Brewed 22.06.10, bottled 03.08.10. Black colour, big to moderate tan head. Lovely vinous aroma, notes of red berries and dark fruits, hints of vanilla, spices, leather and oak. Soft and warming mouthfeel. The flavour has moderately sweet malts (not much roastiness), chocolate and dark fruits, moderate bitterness, hints of spices and liquorice in the finish. A soothing beer indeed.

50 cL bottle. Pours dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is herbal, ginger and dark malty. Slight metallic, dark roasted malty and bitter to acidic chocolate. Ends dry and slight citric to bitter. Ginger just isnt my thing.

Bottle at Borefts Festival. Black bodied with a creamy tan head. The aroma is smoke, caramel, coffee, roast and chocolate. The flavour is smoke, coffee, roasted malt, tobacco and chocolate. Long smokey finish. Lovely.

Bottle at Borefts BF 10. Black colour, brown head. Aroma of lots of herbs, Jägermeister, cardamon, hint of mint, hard roasted malts, coffee. Flavour is herbal, hard roasted malts, coffee, cardamon, mint-like finish with a roast bitterness. Fullbodied. Great.
Bottle at Borefts Bier Festival 2010. Clear dark/dark brown - offwhite head. Raisins, dried fruits, fruity, roasted, berries, nutty, light medicine, licorice notes, light bitterbess. OK.

On bottle @ 2nd BBF. The aroma has caramel, roasted malts, cardamom, liquorice. Black coloured beer with an off-white, thin head. The taste is sweet, has roast, caramel, cardamom and some liquorice. Medium body. okay.
Bottled @ BBF 10. Dark color, short head. Aroma of peanuts, strange spicy, licorice. Strange brew. Nice sirupy malty taste.
Bottle at 2nd BBF @ De Molen. Thick black pour, heavily spiced aroma. Cardamon and berries. Nice full flavor. Lingering spices. Great brew.

Bottle at Borefts Bier Festival 2010.
Black coloured with a small beige head.
Sweet and perfumed aroma of dark chocolate, liquorice and spices.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel, dark chocolate, lqiuorice and spices.
Spicy finish.

500 ml bottle @ Konttori. Brewed 22.6.2010, bottled 3.8.2010.
Pours a pitch black colour with a frothy, brown head. Nice lacing, which disappears quickly. The aroma is light sweet with notes of roasted malts, caamel, gingerbread,  and very interesting herbs; anis and mint. The taste is very smooth with slight roastiness, coffee and dark chocolate. Medium bodied, oily and slicky mouthfeel and very soft carbonation. Nice brew especially for the upcoming winter season.
